title: Cheesy Hamburger Rice Casserole Recipe
description: This hamburger rice casserole with cheese is quick and easy comfort food. Get dinner on the table with just five ingredients!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Cheesy Hamburger Rice Casserole 4.1 (218) 206 Reviews 47 Photos A five-ingredient hamburger rice casserole topped with melty cheese. My grandma used to make this and it was always a hit. She uses American cheese, but I make it with mozzarella. Very easy and yummy! Submitted by MARIAHPIE Updated on November 14, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 47 47 47 47 Servings: 4 Yield: 4 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 pound ground beef 1 (10.75 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice ½ cup long grain white rice ¾ cup shredded mozzarella cheese salt and pepper to taste Directions Crumble the ground beef into a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until evenly browned. Drain off grease, and stir in the cream of mushroom soup, tomatoes, and uncooked rice. Cover, and simmer over low heat, stirring occasionally, until rice is cooked, about 15 minutes. Preheat the oven's broiler. When the rice is done cooking, transfer the contents of the skillet to a casserole dish. Cover with a layer of cheese. Broil until the cheese is melted and toasty. Season with salt and pepper to taste, and enjoy! I Made It Print 444 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 425 Calories 21g Fat 28g Carbs 28g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 425 % Daily Value * Total Fat 21g 27% Saturated Fat 9g 43% Cholesterol 83mg 28% Sodium 849mg 37% Total Carbohydrate 28g 10% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 4g Protein 28g 56% Vitamin C 8mg 8% Calcium 224mg 17% Iron 6mg 34% Potassium 451mg 10% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Cheesy Hamburger Rice Casserole 01 of 47 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 47 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 03/21/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Family favorite I added everything you all mentioned above.1 cup beef bouillon. Extra can of cream of mushroom soup, can of rotel, extra cup rice, basil, garlic powder, Italian seasoning, Worcestershire sauce, and sriracha Doritos on the bottom of the casserole dish. Added pepper jack cheese to the top and broiled. It was so good! Thank you. 03 of 47 Photo by  UncleHanale 11/15/2024 Easy to follow I used canned beef and instant rice for the casserole. I also added crushed corn flakes for the topping. 04 of 47 Photo by  Rachel T 10/23/2024 Easy to follow Pretty good recipe. Next time I will partially cook the rice separately and then add it. 05 of 47 Photo by  Chloe Cook 08/31/2024 I'll try it again but next time I'll cook the rice first. I may add some taco seasoning to the ground beef too. 06 of 47 Photo by  Adam 06/06/2024 OK with tweaks Needs more flavor With the modifications, this was good. First off, I had to double the recipe because 4 servings isn't enough for a family of 4. I used 1 lb ground beef 1 lb sausage. I also used canned diced tomatoes with onions and peppers and I added another additional onion and 2 Tbs of Italian seasoning. Everything else was equally doubled. The cheese I used was a Colby/Monterey Jack cheese mix. With all these modifications, dinner was a success and it beat out other hamburger casseroles I've made before. 07 of 47 Photo by  Fawn 02/17/2024 A keeper! 08 of 47 Photo by  Lisa Vira 01/12/2024 I would absolutely make this again. Comments helped enormously. Added onions, Italian seasoning and garlic powder. Added cooked rice. Also added 1/2 cup of beef broth. Then simmered for 10 min. Added cheese after and let melt in stovetop. 09 of 47 Photo by  Mary C Medford 05/29/2023 It turned out really well! The recipe was easy to make, and on the most part I followed the recipe except that I added dried basil and garlic powder in addition to the salt and pepper. I also used whole milk mozzarella, which amp’d the taste even further. Definitely a recipe I’ll come back to again and again. 10 of 47 Photo by  Sherry 04/17/2023 Super easy, simple recipe. name: MARIAHPIE
instructions: Crumble the ground beef into a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until evenly browned. Drain off grease, and stir in the cream of mushroom soup, tomatoes, and uncooked rice. Cover, and simmer over low heat, stirring occasionally, until rice is cooked, about 15 minutes.;Preheat the oven's broiler. When the rice is done cooking, transfer the contents of the skillet to a casserole dish. Cover with a layer of cheese.;Broil until the cheese is melted and toasty. Season with salt and pepper to taste, and enjoy!
